an1.308:1: "Bhikkhus, I do not see even a single thing on account of which unarisen wholesome qualities do not arise and arisen wholesome qualities decline so much as wrong view.[n.65]Mp:"This is a designation for the sixty-two wrong views"; seeDN ..29–3.3, I 2–39. It seems, though, that the termmicchādiṭṭhiis used in the Nikāyas solely in relation to three views: moral nihilism, the doctrine of non-doing, and the doctrine of non-causality(natthikavāda,akiriyavāda,ahetukavāda).For one of wrong view, unarisen wholesome qualities do not arise and arisen wholesome qualities decline."
